question.Q: Have you had other episodes of diarrhea in the past few weeks?
Do the attacks occur when you are under stress?

See your doctor. Stress can often cause diarrhea. See the chapter REDUCING STRESS (p. 55). If you have episodes of cramping abdominal pain with alternating episodes of constipation and diarrhea, you may have IRRITABLE BOWEL SYNDROME.
Do you have pain in the lower part of your abdomen?
Is there blood or pus in your stools?
See a doctor immediately. Blood or pus in stools could result from an INFLAMMATORY BOWEL DISEASE.
Have you recently started taking any medication?
See your doctor. Sensitivity to some drugs can cause diarrhea.
See your doctor if you are unable to make a diagnosis from this chart and your diarrhea persists for more than 48 hours or recurs.
Have you felt ill or have you been vomiting?
Call your doctor if the symptoms last longer than 48 hours. You may have FOOD POISONING, especially if other people who ate the same food have the same symptoms. Or you could have an ALLERGY TO FOOD.
Is there blood or pus in your stools?
See a doctor immediately. Blood or pus in stools could result from an INFLAMMATORY BOWEL DISEASE.
Have you recently started taking any medication?
See your doctor. Sensitivity to some drugs can cause diarrhea.
See your doctor if you are unable to make a diagnosis from this chart and your diarrhea persists for more than 48 hours or recurs.
